subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyone help ?
author: psfponies
full_text:
--0-251964466-1206925231=:35670
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

The invitation isn't much good if you don't get back to people who email you!
   
  Kay

bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
      .hmmessage P  {  margin:0px;  padding:0px  }  body.hmmessage  {  FONT-SIZE: 10pt;  FONT-FAMILY:Tahoma  }    Maragaret,
 
The reason I extend an invitation to new people to contact me off group if they wish,
Is for two reasons, the first most new people tend to be shy and reserved and intimidated when it comes to asking public questions
most feel that their questions may be viewed as silly or not deserving of serious explination. I have encountered many instances like this.
It just helps them to take the first couple of steps if they feel they are in a confidential environment.
 
Also, I tend to be very long winded in my responses and answers with explinations, and I don't think that the more experienced 
members here that have heard it all before care to hear a three paragraph post on why you should use the 470 instead of the 469.
 
I am always available on and off board to answer any and all questions I am able.
 
Bruce


  Bruce Halliday 




    
---------------------------------
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
From: ITCdeadpeople@...
Date: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 22:18:57 +0000
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyone help ?

        Hi Bruce. Just a thought.... It's really sweet of you to make yourself so available to people, 
but if you have members take inquiries of this nature off the boards by having them 
contact your privately, you are limiting the amount of learning that can take place. There 
are likely "lurkers" here, who will never join or come forward, but could really benefit from 
Lyn's questions and the answers she receives from the group. 

Taking communication privately also eliminates the possibility for her to receive multiple 
opinions. (not to imply there isn't a time for privacy!) ;0)

Like I said, just a thought. 

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Lyn,
> 
> I would be happy to help you and answer any questions you have.
> you can e-mail me if you like
> 
> paranormalinvestigating@...
> 
> any time
> Bruce
> Bruce Halliday 
> 
> 
> To: EVP-ITC@...: ITCdeadpeople@...: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 20:09:51 +0000Subject: [EVP-
ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyone help ?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Hi Lyn. I'm sure several of us here could help you. What are your questions? Margaret--
- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Lyn" <angels4lyn@> wrote:>> HI> I'm one of the quiet 
members here. trying to learn from everyone.> I have activity in my home. so I purchased 
an RCA digital recorder> which is amazing.> I have captured several EVPs, some quite 
clear, some a bit too fast> so I slow it down to hear it. some are voices , some answer 
questions, some > are just noises.> > does anyone have experience with EVPs on digital 
recorders ?> I have a ton of questions... and need advice on some of them.> > thanks> 
Lyn> angels4lyn@> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
